cal

=
Inside the ship Scourge is running to chase down his fleeing prey, 
his wea=
pons at the ready as his face wears a grim look of 
determination. Trailing=
 behind him where four other sweeps running 
like soldiers in lock step wit=
h thier commander. 

They all screech to a stop, Scourge holding up a hand,=

around as they could all feel the sudden a force shield that =
sprang 
into place cutting them off from Rodimus. 

Even as the spun around=
, standing back to back as they surveyed the 
area, guns came alive on the =
walls and began to orient on the 
minions, and cut into them with metal cut=
ting fury!!

Scourge grunted as the bullets burned into him! Although his a=
rmor 
was tough and designed for heavy combat, even he was not impervious 
=
to the attacks. The sweeps were not doing as well as he was. Two of 
them w=
ere cut down immidiatly, and the other two were looking worn. 

Looking up =
down he smiled as lubricant leaked from several wounds, 
for he noticed the=
 age of the floors and the walls of this room. This 
ship had been abandone=
d for quite some time, and time had not been 
kind to it. The walls were ru=
sting in spots and the floors were not 
much better. The fiasco with the gr=
eandes on the level above was 
proof of that!

With a feral gin Scourge poi=
nted his weapon upward, "The battle is 
not over yet prey! We are comming f=
or you!!!"

Most ship shields were designed to capture prisoners two 
dimen=
tionally, foward, back and to the sides, Scourge on the other 
hand was cre=
ating a door the ship was not prepared to block. With a 
smile he fired his=
 disintergration beams upwards, vaporizing the 
upward bulkheads. 

With a =
leap he and the two remaining sweeps with him leaped into the 
air, shiftin=
g into thier sleeker, and better masked hunter-seekers 
modes they few upwa=
rds, thier weapons blasting upwards even as the 
ship attempted to contain =
fire on them as they moved!

Finally, with a terrific explosion, one that s=
ent metal debris over 
the side of the ship and into the surrounding area, =
they fairly 
errupted from the top of the ship, not too far from where the =
bridge 
sat. 

Floating in mid air, his sensor scattering armor keeping the=
 ship's 
autoguns at bay, now that they were free of the ship enviorns, he =

looked around as he assessed the situation. 

Only two of the six sweeps h=
e had brough with him had survived, and 
from the looks of things Rodimus h=
ad continued to flee. Scourge had 
failed, and he knew it. 

"Commander" Sc=
ourge's voice crackled across the minion encrypted 
channel, "Rodimus has s=
uccessfully fled the ship and is headed in 
your direction, I failed to des=
troy him."

After a pause Cyclonus' calm voice transmitted itself to 
Scour=
ge, "No, your attack on him was a test, his destruction will be 
at MY hand=
. Had you succeeded then he would be unworthy of me, like 
all the rest tha=
t have faced me. It would seem there something of the 
Prime in him after a=
ll." 

The voice of Cyclonus paused for a moment and then continued, "Retur=
n 
to my location, here you will find a way to redeem yourself."

"Yes." Ca=
me Scourge's reply, the voice of an mech who had been just 
been given a st=
ay of execution. "I am on my way!"

nto the air, moving swiftly
